reviews.review_msg: Christina is a typical academic who teaches finance but never worked in the field. It clearly shows in how she teaches the course. Not worth the money paid for it. You can get more out of reading a textbook and checking out related materials online. I was not happy at all with her course despite doing fine in it. As well, I find her rude.

worst finance prof at sfu, final project is an absolute joke, she did not teach us or explain to us the projects, her lectures and assignments have almost no correlation, moreover she is lazy and doesn't even mark any assignments and her online assignments were peer marked instead, which is biased

Definitely one of the worst profs or the worst prof I have had at SFU. Her lectures don't make sense, majority of her grades are based on peer evaluations which is not the best for curved courses. Not understanding AT ALL. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HER

This prof is the absolute worst when it comes to a Finance class. She made no sense all semester long and just rambles on about random things that make no sense. Do not make the mistake of taking her you will regret it very fast. The final project makes zero sense, I mean zero. She needs to stop teaching, she would do better working in an office.

This prof is definately the worst prof I have taken at sfu. This class makes absolutely no sense and this prof can not teach. I am absolutely lost whenever the lecture starts no idea what is going on.

Sometimes her quizzes have contradicting instructions. No midterms or final. Instead, we are given assignments and quizzes. She does not mark the assignment nor do the TAs. She uses a AI peer eval website called kritik. Essentially, the students mark each other. This is all in the name of "learning opportunity for students", but she is just lazy

Do not make the same mistake I made. Rude, confusing and not willing to accomodate students at all. Takes marks off on quizzes for the silliest of reasons and is rude later when someone asks why marks were taken off. Uploads 2 lectures with the same slide deck but different explanations to confuse students. DO NOT take this course with her.

worst finance prof at sfu!! avoid her if you can. her lectures are all over the place, and she does not explain course material well, often going off topic. you're better off just reading her lecture slides after class. she doesn't accomodate students at all- even during COVID when everyone has different situations at home.

She is a very nice person and tries to explain things but is very unclear. The slides are also not good at all and her lectures involve her drawing things that have almost no relation to what is going on. The trading reports are also very vague and hard to know what she wants you to do for marks. Overall, shes a nice person but not a good professor

Christina is one of the hardest profs for finance. She really knows her stuff but sometimes she does not provide very clear instructions, so make sure you ask. Overall recommended for anyone serious in finance!

Christina does not provide clear outlines for how to do the weekly trading assignments at all. Our class average for these was very low. When you send her an email she is very unclear in her replies. She scribbles on her device all lecture long while her notes are not related to the quizzes we have. I learn better by reading the textbook.

many people don't like Christina because she is a very difficult marker on assignments, and quizzes. She is a difficult marker because she wants us to understand that making the wrong trade can result in millions of dollars of losses. Christina's lectures explain the concepts betters than the book because she explains why we are doing it.

Professor Atanasova is just all over the place. The lectures do not follow an outline, it is just scribble drawings on a piece of paper with no real impact on the lecture. Everyone in the class is confused about the weekly assignments and quizzes yet she provides zero help. She needs to be more organized and have clearer outlines of what she wants.

Her lectures are just some confusing drawings and she does not follow slides or an order and lectures are overall confusing. She does not even finish the majority of lectures and puts all material on quizzes which are about half of our total grade. The quizzes are much harder than lectures and don't follow what she teaches. Low average for class.

Worst prof ever at SFU. Her quizzes and homework assignments are very unclear and unorganized. She does not specify rounding requirements on quizzes, and does not teach how to do the weekly trading reports at all; none of her lecture materials are related to the assignments. The course itself is easy, but she will make it hard for you

Christina is one of the better professors at SFU! I definitely recommend taking 316 with her! She's very good at explaining the topics and uses examples to explain everything! Her exams are VERY fair. As long as you understand what is discussed during lecture, and do some practice questions on your own time, you are good to go!
She is a awful teacher. I knew the topic very well, but I realized she has no clue. She has taught this course and similar course in master level, which that is a shame!
She's very willing to talk to her student and help.  Overall, Great Prof!  Not sure what's all the talk about the course being hard.  She is probably the easiest prof that you will get teaching 316.

Christina was a very nice prof! She tried to explain the course material as clear as possible! Her midterm was very similar to the practice questions in the bad so it'll be helpful if you guys actually go through the questions. Also, she'kinda hot haha.
Great prof.  The class is fairly hard, but much easier than 315.  If you go regularly and try some of the textbook questions, its a really easy course.  Prof is awesome and easy on the eyes too!

I filled out the comment below this one, I don't know why it says poor quality though? I think the prof is pretty good actually...the material is a bit challenging...but I mean it is a 300 level Finance course...

like the person below me wrote, get yourself the study guide and do the problems.  Some of the proofs may be a little challenging to understand but that shouldn't prevent you from doing well if you more or less understand the basics of the class and can follow the order of operations for the different types of problems involving hedging, arbitrage
good prof, get yourself the studyguide and do the practice question to make it easier for yourself.
She is one of the better professors at SFU Business.
Awesome! enjoy the class with her

Really nice prof, but she has an extremely hard time conveying the information in lectures.  At times she made the topic much much more confusing and difficult due to her lack of clarity.  Chrisitina was super helpful though during her office hours, and made up for the extremely difficult exams by marking generously.
She's pretty good in explaining things during her office hours, midterm was fair but final was just uber hard

3hr class now a 45 min "Q&A" session where he answers your questions. does 0 teaching, expects you to watch videos and other things on your own bc he "doesnt really care for his opinion". From the get go he assumes you know how to interpret futures/options on cme group with NO prior knowledge. If I knew how to do all this id be on wall street

Agree with below about the tricky Q's in exams. When he says u just need to know his lecture notes for the exams - he's LYING. u have to read the textbook. And make sure u do all the chapter exercises - sometimes he uses the exact same text Q's in his exams. ~Lazy and tricky prof.
I don't think's easy. Very unclear and unprepared. Make up questions on exams that you have no clue what it is asking about.
Very lazy and unclear professor. I do not why SFU still let him teach! Avoid him if you like risk management.
Who said he is easy? I don't think so. He will ask you to prove math formulas in midterm...so not easy. Maybe he read the earlier comments.
easy
He cannot teach. But if you want an easy time. go with him. if you want to learn sth, stay away from him.
Easy calculations...still got tricked by him in the exam with the proves
No Comments
easy easy easy
great prof.
He likes to throw in some jokes once in a while.
The best teacher I've had in Business
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
People who took 316 with him probably didn't try. He's a fine professor if you're a good student.
often ignore emails, expect students to take 315 before taking 316, confusing grading system, confusing explanation , heavy dependent on textbook which is incredibly dry... should I go on?
attending lecture confuses more rather than helping...
Easy class, though the prof doesn't put much effort in.  There's too much reliance on the text, and no answers to check with.

I normally do not complain if a prof's teaching ability is somewhat below average, but I have to say that this prof is a total trash, and I absolutely mean it. Cocky attitude. Does not reply e-mail. Shows absolutely no interest in this class. He's a disgrace to all the profs out there.

Prof put in no effort to actually teach the class and even studying the textbook questions and her practice exams aren't much help. Exams are way harder than they need to be and no partial marks are given so failing an exam is common. Tests you on chapters that are not assigned for the exams. Overall just an awful experience.

Prof is nice and tries to be helpful. However, her exams are very difficult and no amount of studying is enough. There are no partial marks given for work, and no assignments. Exam worth 25% in the third week of class on 5 chapters, making it very difficult to study with such less time.

She doesn't show up to class, teaches something else and tests something else, most of the course we self study from the textbook. We didn't know our assignment marks till final exam due to professor being lazy. Students cheat as she was disorganized and lazy that she couldn't even do anything about it. And she is not passionate about her work.

Awful professor and awful course format. All lectures had mistakes and there was errors in the questions on the exams. Despite being in person class, prof decided to conduct exams on canvas which was a mess. Created so many issues academic integrity problems etc. Shocked that she was able to teach this class, disappointing from the school...

Avoid this professor at all costs. I've personally NEVER met such an incompetent, lazy, and full of excuses type of person who doesn't seem passionate about what she teaches. Makes excuses for not appearing in class and doesn't respond to emails or questions.

Tara is a kind person, and will definitely help you if you are able to reach out to her, however her class structure, organization, tests, and content are a disaster to try to understand/prepare for in order to grade your knowledge. You will be told to learn xyz chapters and be faced with problems outside of what you studied on tests. Avoid!

I have no idea how she's still eligible to teach. Hasn't gotten one single grade back to students, so we have no idea how we are even doing in the course and it's almost ending. She doesn't get back to students on time, and we have to learn the material ourselves. Avoid at all costs. I mean it.

Tara is overly enthusiastic it's a bit worrisome. Her BUS 316 exams are a complete disaster and give little to no time for us to finish them. The majority of the class didn't have sufficient time and she completely brushed it off. This professor should not be teaching by any means. Avoid at all costs.
Tara is the best derivative professor at SFU, if I have a chance, I will take this professor's course again.
She is very experienced. Her classes are fun and useful.
Awesome teacher. She has intensive corporate experience. Therefore, her teaching style is very practical!!! Highly recommended!
Stayed well beyond her office hours to help students before the exam.

She appears to be unclear at the beginning, but if you attend class and go to her for clarification, you'll realize that she is extremely helpful and clear. She is one of the most patient profs I've seen and she goes out of her way to ensure fairness. She'll actually email you personally if she feels like you deserve better!!
He couldn't explain simple matters to students probably b/c he's too smart...
teaches for 45 mins then concludes, "you guys don't need to know this"
he has to realize most of us don't have a graduate degree
will have to try very hard to fail this course
Brilliant, smart guys would love him. But most of us are just average...
Can you imagine that you would earn an easy B with nothing learned?
Prepare answers for his sample exam and u'll ace his course!
helpless, never assign any questions but ask theoretical ques on quiz and exam never mentioned before.

Quiz is easy. Its the exact same questions from the solution manual so you can easily just memorize it. Midterm was hard avg was 55%. Final I thought was fair until I saw my mark. She teaches fast and the examples she gives are easier than the questions she posts on the exams. I wouldn't take her again.

She is the worth prof I ever Had in SFU. Horrible. The point is the class ever teaches you anything, I learned everything by the text book. She just reads off slides ( you are not even her own slides). At the end you probably will get average grade, but you paid your tuition to learn nothing. Thought BUS 316 suppose to be interesting too =(

Lectures can be long and a little boring. Spends a lot of time on small matters and rushes through other material. BUT if you review his lecture notes after the lecture you are able to connect the ideas really well as they are well prepared.

Avi is the best prof I've ever had!!! Had the absolute pleasure of being one of his last students. Even though he is retiring - insight into 316 (couldn't find any when I looked be4): MT and 1/2 of course quite easy. Becomes increasingly complex into B/S model and binary trees. Nevertheless a straightforward course. Staying on track is imperative.
Without a doubt BEST PROF I have ever had. All the material u need is provided. He tests based on his practice questions so make sure to practice.

The midterm was reasonable as you could do well on it by doing the practice ques. The assign were fine as well. His classes were soo boring and long that he just read over the notes and it was a waste of time.

The final exam was extremely difficult. Did all the practice ques but none of the ques came from there. He chose very specific ques.

He is knowledgeable but cannot deliver his knowledge in lectures. Makes it super boring and hard to understand. His notes are confusing but save textbook costs. Would prefer other profs over him. Overall, a sweet person.

Very patient and generous. He replied to e-mails quickly. He is also willing to explain his expectations clearly so that his students can have an easier life. Final exams are harder than the mid-term. But you can still get good grades if you through all his notes and do his practice questions.

Prof provides you all the notes that he will go through, so going to class isn't mandatory. Nice professor, and will definitely try to help you understand. Make sure you do majority of the practice problems before exams. Midterm was easy high average, but final is much harder and had a much lower average.
Very patient and nice prof! Midterm is easy and final is hard. But it is fair!

Awarded best teacher twice, not for nothing. Extraordinarily creative ways of simplifying and explaining financial methods. One of the best profs I ever had. Take any course you can with him. It'll be a pleasure.

One of my best at SFU :) He explained everything clearly and slowly so that students can follow in class without any preparation in advance. Midterm is just like optional practices, so make sure you do them. Final is harder, especially theory MCQs, but still fair.

His explanations are straightforward if you pre-read before class. MIdterm average was ridiculously high, but is a given as he posts everything online and it is very, very similar. Final was a bit harder, but pretty straightforward. If you dont do well in a high-average class, youll probs do below average here.

One of the best prof I've met in SFU, he is definitely knowledgeable and kind. Derivatives is a hard and complicated topic while Avi made it super simple to learn through his well-organized notes. And he always gives good feedbacks, he doesn't speak fast but he makes it clear for students. Highly recommend him for BUS 316.

He is a really good prof. Learn a lot from him. His lectures are so clear and well-organized. He gives you everything so that no need to buy textbook. In order to do well, just attend every lecture, pay attention, do the assignments and sample practices, you will be good. PS: He is like a warm grandpa

His lecture notes are very clear so no need to buy the textbook. The class is boring that he just reads his notes. Easy midterm, the final is cumulative and more difficult. Make sure you have do all the readings, do practice problems and homework before the exam.
Took 316 this fall. Notes are crystal clear. Easy midterm, only a bit slightly harder final. As long as you do the practice and homework by yourself, you will be fine. Easy A+

He is one of the best professors I have in SFU. He is extremely helpful and his notes are so great... read his notes and assignments and make sure you understand the material. Then you can get an A in this class for sure

He's a nice guy. The thing I like about him is that he replies your emails quickly. No need to buy the textbook because his notes are sufficient for the exams. Assignments and exams are easy but the class curve was so high... it may work against you. It didn't for me.
first 100% final mark for me at SFU.
Super easy...and his online notes are so detail and helpful...if you understand the assignments...you could get a "B" for sure...however, the course is easy so that the curve will be kinda high.

He must have known everyone was saying he's easy... coz he made the final exam extremely killer. Boring, boring lectures, he could make an easy stuff seem so complicated and advanced.  He's a nice guy, but he should just retire.
Way TOO EASY. Everyone in the class had over 90%, people who only care about easiness will rate him high. He is a nice guy and decent teacher but his testing is terrible.
He is awesome and helpful and I got A+ from him
Avi's cool...I would take another class with him.
can't teach or speak english. Exams are too easy= average is 80%= B-.
He is the best prof ever!

Though she has bad reviews, she is a really good professor. The course material itself is tough, but she is always open to questions and demonstrates in class how to solve problems. Provides a solid outline of what to expect. Would definitely take an again. Very kind and humble.

Make sure you actually understand the concepts instead of memorizing patterns. Final exam is much harder than the midterm so study in advance. Understanding the homework assignments will help you immensely on exams as some questions are repeated and the hw assignments are comprehensive in nature, preparing you for exams. She is a good teacher.
She's nice but her notes aren't that good. Her teaching pace is terrible and kind of dry.

Ying was very nice and was clear with all the grading criteria and what was going to be tested. Only complaint is that her lectures were quite boring and dry, so it was pretty hard to focus and understand the material. Best way I learned was just by doing practice problems and reviewing the answers.

Told us what we needed to know and what we didn't from lecture material. Suggested we do the textbook questions to prepare for the final and ALL of the final questions were word for word questions from the assigned tb/hw questions (w/ different numbers). If you listen to her, the course is very doable and you might actually learn something.

Without a doubt the worst prof I've had at SFU. Her homework assignments are wordy, long, and cover concepts we don't even talk about in lecture. We have a final worth 62% coming up and when she asked for a practice final, format, what to study , etc., she responded "read the textbook and do the practice problems in the book". AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Ying the worst prof I have ever had at SFU. If you have to take this class, PLEASE save yourself and take it with a different prof. Let's talk about the final exam as this is worth 62% of your final grade (no midterm) We were not given any instructions, practice, or chapters/concepts to focus on. Format of exam was found when we started it.. AVOID

Hardest class taken in beedie so far. Ying was super hard to understand and hearing her voice just makes you want to rip your hair out. She only responded to emails with a few words when asked about her ambigiously worded assignments. 60% Final exam too... Well, my conclusion is AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS. I hope she gets fired.

Worst prof at beedie so far.... the final exam was unrealistically difficult in terms of content and time limit. Each question required an individual word doc which takes a significant amount of time out of the 2 hours. Avoid at all costs.
Absolute worst prof at beedie. First class I've ever taken where I seriously considered asking for a refund.
Why did anyone let teach him finance?
